subject: Fashion
title: The Red Dress Effect
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Red Dress Effect.

hook.text: Women in red are rated more attractive by men across every culture tested. The effect is consistent.

buildup.text: Psychologist Andrew Elliot found men offered women in red more expensive dates and closer seating.

discovery.text: The effect may be biological. Many primate species use red signals for matingâ€”think baboon faces.

twist.text: Women rating other women in red show no attraction boostâ€”only increased rivalry and perceived threat.

climax.text: A single color triggers completely different psychological responses depending on who is looking.

punchline.text: Red attracts and intimidates. Same dress, different audience.

quiz.question: How do women typically respond to other women wearing red, according to studies?
options: They perceive increased rivalry and threat, not increased attractiveness
They rate them as equally more attractive, just like male participants do
They show no measurable psychological response to the color at all
